Join ASA!
Regulatory Update for Foreign Schools Webex
National FFELP guarantor American Student Assistance® (ASA) has designed an on-line training series to discuss some of the most pressing topics affecting U.S. financial aid at international universities. These events are designed specifically for international institutions.
Dates and Time:
Tuesday 12/2/2008 15:00 a.m. - 17:00 a.m. GMT 10:00 a.m. EST - 12:00 p.m. EST
Wednesday 12/3/2008 13:00 a.m. - 15:00 a.m. GMT 8:00 a.m. EST - 10:00 a.m. EST
Course Description: A quick first glimpse of some of the changes drafted into the Higher Education Act Reauthorization Bill. We will review Higher Education Opportunity Act of 2008 (HR 4137) as passed into law on August 14, 2008. While it's early in the game to discuss details and implementation, this session can give you a head start on knowing what to expect. You will also have the opportunity to have your questions answered.
Who Should Attend
Any financial aid administrator interested in the most up to date information.
How to register or for additional information.
· Register Online at https://amsa.webex.com/mw0305l/mywebex/default.do?siteurl=amsa&service=6 · Email: send your name, phone number and enrollment details to training@amsa.com · Phone: call the Training Department at (800) 999-9080, ext. 3099 (1-617-728-4200)
All American Student Assistance training events are offered free of charge, however the dial in conference call will be at international rates for a call to the U.S.
